image.altText: A close-up of an unidentified child's legs on a pavement.

items.synopsis: South Australia's Department for Child Protection failed to ensure the protection of children was its "paramount consideration" when dealing with more than 90 notifications about two families, the state's ombudsman finds.

title.children: Child protection authorities failed to investigate dozens of red flags in 'tragic reality', report finds

image.altText: A selfie of a woman in a Western Bulldogs top.

items.synopsis: A woman who fatally stabbed her mother in a drunken rage at their home in Adelaide's north could be eligible for parole in less than two years after a judge found there were "exceptional circumstances".

title.children: Daughter jailed for fatally stabbing mother in Adelaide's north

image.altText: A woman sits on a couch and holds a phone to her ear.

items.synopsis: An ombudsman report says too many telcos are failing to comply with the rules, and some of the rules are too soft, causing distress for phone and internet users.

title.children: Marina logged 52 hours trying to get her phone fixed. The ombudsman wants new rules

image.altText: A small submarine appearing to dive downwards into the ocean.

items.synopsis: It's not just the location and the enormous search area making it hard to find the Titan.

title.children: Why the Titanic tourist submersible is so hard to find, even if it has surfaced

image.altText: A ship involved in the search for the missing OceanGate submersible in the North Atlantic.

items.synopsis: Rescue teams are racing to trace the origin of sounds heard from the depths of the North Atlantic in a search for a tourist submersible with five people on board that vanished on its descent to the century-old wreck of the Titanic.

title.children: Authorities say they don't know the source of underwater noises heard in search for submersible

image.altText: Xavier Coates celebrates

items.synopsis: Queensland secures the State of Origin shield with a 32-6 win in the second game at Lang Park, marking the Maroons' third series victory from the past four years.

title.children: Queensland completes emphatic Origin series victory after tempers flare with late send-offs

image.altText: A close up of Yevgeny Prigozhin and Vladimir Putin.

items.synopsis: As Russia moves to take control of Wagner with its push for recruits to sign contracts before July 1, Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the mercenary group, has vowed a boycott. Now everyone is waiting to see if he will ultimately bend to the Russian leader's will — and what happens if he refuses.

title.children: From Putin's 'chef' to Putin's 'butcher' to Putin's enemy: Why Prigozhin appears to have fallen out with the president

image.altText: The Twitter app icon is seen on an iPhone with a green background.

items.synopsis: Billionaire Elon Musk's social media platform Twitter has been issued with a demand from Australian authorities for information on what it is doing to tackle online hate.

title.children: Australia issues Twitter with a 'please explain' notice over surge in online hate

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a colourful painting.

items.synopsis: An independent watchdog says children at Adelaide's youth detention centre spent up to 21 hours straight isolated in cells — an allegation the state government rejects.

title.children: 'Genuine hurt': Watchdog raises concerns over SA youth detention isolation

image.altText: A building with a bullnose roof and stop signs out the front

items.synopsis: SA Health says an independent review will investigate claims of a "dire" culture of bullying directed towards workers at the James Nash House forensic mental health facility.

title.children: 'Bullying culture' claims at SA forensic facility triggers independent review

image.altText: A close up of the word 'POLICE' on a white car

items.synopsis: The additional powers will allow officers to conduct on-the-spot searches, use metal detectors on a person for weapons or order a person posing a risk to the community to leave a public space, seven nights a week.

title.children: Anti-social behaviour target of Adelaide CBD police crackdown

image.altText: A three-letter logo "pwc" on a wall, with a head in shadow walking past beneath it.

items.synopsis: A parliamentary committee has described the actions of consulting firm PwC in monetising confidential federal government information as "a calculated breach of trust".

title.children: Parliamentary report finds PwC engaged in 'calculated breach of trust', but won't release list of staff involved in tax leaks

image.altText: Australia's players and coaches huddle for a group photo with the Women's Ashes trophy

items.synopsis: You've heard of Bazball, but what about Jonball? Australia and England are set to fire in the upcoming Women's Ashes series.

title.children: 'I get grumpy when people say that': The key change that could define the Women's Ashes series

image.altText: A man in a suit with an NDIS sign

items.synopsis: NDIS participants will have more control over the length of their plans within the next 12 months, according to the Minister for the National Disability Insurance Scheme Bill Shorten.

title.children: NDIS minister vows to crack down on prices, offers participants greater flexibility

image.altText: A picture of a sign which says Titanic survey expedition.

items.synopsis: As the search continues for the missing Titan submersible, questions are being raised around the vessel's safety and what could have possibly gone wrong.

title.children: Was the Titan safe? Questions raised over what went wrong with the missing submersible

image.altText: A large sign reading Port Pirie Regional Health Service outside a collection of buildings.

items.synopsis: A nursing union calls for 24/7 security guards after five medical staff were injured by a man suffering a psychotic episode at a South Australian hospital.

title.children: Two nurses and three doctors attacked by patient in 'terrifying incident' at regional hospital

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie in front of a road sign.

items.synopsis: The Geelong-born 56-year-old is hoping to set a world record by becoming the fastest woman to complete the 2,500km journey on foot.

title.children: Nikki Love has already burned through 10 pairs of shoes and passed the 1,500km mark on her run from Sydney to Perth

image.altText: A kangaroo stands in front of two soccer boots, one made by Nike and the other by Puma.

items.synopsis: Commercial kangaroo shooters are regulated under a national code that's supposed to protect animal welfare, but activists say what happens in rural Australia at night can be in breach of it, putting the industry under threat.

title.children: Why big brands in the US are ditching kangaroo leather

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo gazing into the distance with her arms folded

items.synopsis: The special investigator appointed to build criminal cases against those involved in the Lawyer X scandal has attacked the director of public prosecutions for refusing to approve criminal charges against them.

title.children: Former High Court judge asked to assess potential Lawyer X charges lashes the state's chief prosecutor

image.altText: Lea Russ lying in a hospital bed wearing a blue surgical mask, with her arm hooked up to an IV.

items.synopsis: Patients who need to see a GP urgently are increasingly waiting more than 24 hours to be seen. But they may not know that general practices are meant to offer emergency bookings.

title.children: Getting an urgent GP appointment can be hard, but a little-known rule means it shouldn't be

image.altText: Police tape and bloodied steps at a home with a gate in it

items.synopsis:
A Broken Hill man has been flown to Adelaide following a stabbing at a home in the city's north. 

It's not known what the exact circumstances are surrounding the stabbing, but the men are believed to be known to each other.

title.children: Broken Hill man fights for life after late-night stabbing

image.altText: A woman in a dark shirt speaking to Netbal players in red shirts.

items.synopsis: The Adelaide Thunderbirds are back from the netball wilderness after a four-year rebuild by coach Tania Obst, turning the side from the competition's easybeats to a team that is now just two wins from claiming a fifth flag.

title.children: An Australian sporting powerhouse lost 27 games in a row. Now, a netball legend has revived the club

image.altText: A man has short grey hair and blue eyes, he wears a grey polo, he stands in front of a damaged house with water marks

items.synopsis: Kyle Smith says it's been a rough road since floodwaters receded months ago, but he's grateful for the support of volunteers helping to clean up his community.

title.children: Emotional impact of cleaning up after Murray River flood takes its toll

image.altText: A composite image showing a young man, a woman and an older man.

items.synopsis: Confidentiality laws have long kept the plight of people whose finances are controlled by the state hidden from view, but there are growing calls for the agencies these vulnerable people depend on to be subjected to greater scrutiny.

title.children: Can public trustees' controversial business model withstand the spotlight?

image.altText: Woman with long dark hair in a black tee shirt.

items.synopsis: A health service executive says young kids are getting the devices from home, amid calls for more education about the dangers of the habit.

title.children: Health forum hears four-year-old Indigenous children are vaping as addiction rates rise

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

items.synopsis: At the time of the incident at the Yallambee Lodge nursing home last month, questions were raised as to why the original media release from NSW Police omitted the word "taser".

title.children: 'Really questions her competence': NSW minister under fire over claims of cover-up over tasering of 95yo

image.altText: a woman walking a long a street smiling

items.synopsis: The delivery of the report into whether Gladys Berejiklian breached public trust faced lengthy delays and comes more than two-and-a-half years ago after the corruption watchdog's hearings.

title.children: Date set for release of corruption findings into former NSW premier Gladys Berejiklian

image.altText: A frozen bubble, with icicle underneath it.

items.synopsis: Temperatures across NSW plummeted overnight. It's now been confirmed many towns have experienced their coldest June morning on record.

title.children: New records set for coldest June morning after freezing conditions hit nation's south-east overnight

image.altText: Sydney gay hate murders

items.synopsis: Legal correspondence about an inquiry into gay hate crimes reveals NSW Police provided material more than a year late and seemingly found old crime scene photographs "by chance".

title.children: Police found crime scene photos 'by chance' 40 years after toilet block death, letters show

image.altText: A smiling young woman on a carousel.

items.synopsis: Niamh Maye was 18 years old when she disappeared from a country town in NSW in 2002. With her family still desperate for answers, police are hoping a large reward will encourage someone to come forward.

title.children: On the day Niamh would have turned 40, police offer $250k in push to solve decades-old mystery

image.altText: woman in scrubs stands cross armed

items.synopsis: A rushed takeover sale could leave a regional Victoria community without any doctors due to "clinical governance" concerns.

title.children: Vic town's only GPs vow to leave if sale of health service proceeds

image.altText: People holding up alcoholic cocktails

items.synopsis: Going alcohol-free can spare you a hangover and save money — unless your new drink of choice is the zero-free version of certain high-profile tipples, writes Cameron Shackell.

title.children: Why are non-alcoholic drinks so expensive when they have less tax and no booze?

image.altText: Old man with grey hair and button up shirt

items.synopsis: John Kerr, 87, was found on Noosa's Hastings Street with severe head injuries on Sunday morning.

title.children: Police investigating Noosa man's Hastings St death release CCTV of potential witnesses

image.altText: Several poker machines inside a club.

items.synopsis: A court hears Cameron Gidley-Baird is "disgusted" with himself and "desperately sorry" as he is sentenced to a maximum of six-and-a-half years' jail.

title.children: Man who defrauded farmers of $1.8m and blew money on pokies, horses and alcohol jailed

image.altText: Three grey nurse sharks, near the surface of the water.

items.synopsis: The group of grey nurse sharks are attracting attention with their visits close to shore on the NSW Mid North Coast, but their arrival has come with a warning.

title.children: Onlookers delighted as endangered sharks congregate near coastal breakwall
